title: Ticket #5625: Overhaul grid universe job leases
description:
The management of job leases in the grid universe needs several improvements. The calculation of leases is overly complex, especially when many jobs must share the same lease. Recently, users reported that the gridmanager was setting abnormally short leases for cream jobs, and it was difficult to trace the code to see how that could happen. There are also several inefficiencies in how leases are renewed for Condor-C jobs.

We propose the following changes to the job lease code for the grid universe:

  • All jobs managed by the same Resource object in the gridmanager share a single lease
    • Lease duration is minimum of all current jobs
    • Allow individual jobs to have no lease, where already supported (grid-type condor)
  • Remove CalculateJobLease() function
  • Simplify lease update sequence in BaseResource in the gridmanager
    • Don't require synching of lease update in local job queue before doing update to remote server
    • Remove ATTR_LAST_JOB_LEASE_RENEWAL_FAILED
    • Update lease expiration time in local Job objects only after remote operation succeeds

The following changes will be considered for a future release:

  • In c-gahp, use SetAttribute() with NoAck flag to update lease expiration times
  • Consider requiring leases for grid-type condor jobs
    • Make default lease duration configurable, possibly per grid-type
remarks:
2016-May-04 11:16:27 by jfrey:
One issue with using the NoAck flag for lease updates in the c-gahp is that if one job disappears from the remote job queue, all lease updates will fail with no indication of why.
